intro: Meibomia sylvestris, commonly known as the forest meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and often display white or pale pink hues.
